data.title: Stinks, as in unpleasant smell
data.text: We stopped in hopeful for some good Irish fare...but just couldn't stay.  The smell very unpleasant, we didn't even order a drink.  This was a bummer because we had a really good time here two years ago.

data.title: Lunch downtown
data.text: I finally made a point of stopping here today for lunch and found it to be pleasant. I know it is a popular spot at night, but I found it a great place for a good lunch. Staff was accommodating and pleasant without being overbearing. Atmosphere is cool and open to the outdoors. The food was great - a steady pub menu, nothing pretentious but just good food prepared well. I will definitely be back again.

data.title: not impressed
data.text: When they first opened they were pretty good.  It has gone downhill since.  The food is mediocre, it smells funny in there and the bathroom is not clean and shared with the next door business.

data.title: Welcome end to a long day
data.text:
We had just flown across the country for a wedding and were meeting up friends and family here. The place was fun, clean and friendly. We drank all night and were very pleased with our bar tab.
The Irish mule was especially good. 
Good choice in an area with a limited late night bar scene.

data.title: A place for good company and good food
data.text:
Over the years I have visited this place. From date nights to work type functions. Normally for work, we gather the folks of our department, and have a lunch to celebrate holidays.

  The food is real good and the atmosphere is awesome. I recommend this spot if you're looking for a cool little pub to blow off some steam and want to relax.

data.title: Bar scene Santa Rosa
data.text: During my visit we where greeted with a nice smile and good attitude from the door bouncer! We ordered some beers on tap and where given plastic cups which caused our beers to go flat instantly. During our second beer we got overwhelmed with the security and staff hurry to get us out of our chairs to make room for their nightly bar guest, didn't say why just removed our tables and eventually our chairs, and  kinda rude I would say. The rest of the security staff started to arrive and created more of a hostile situation talking about their war battles and how they expected their night to be. There was a particular guy that grabbed my attention it appeared to be an employee there but was off  work or on his day off, it seem like he was instigating trouble during the night. He even told the door man to not let some people in just because he didn't like them. Notice him hugging a couple female customers that didn't really appreciated it, but he left laughing like he said or did something amazing. The security staff really need their act together, there where a couple of situations where security was  breached (people passing a jacket before being searched and people that came what apear to be with their friends not searched at all) it made me feel some what unsafe. The bar staff was good for a couple of ours and then their attitude changed it seemed like it was overwhelming or lack of experience.  Bathrooms not very clean and not set up for large crowds. The best thing there was when we left!

data.title: Rustic Irish Pub, great food!
data.text: We stopped in during the Peggy Sue classic car event. It was pretty crowded, but must have been meant to be as soon as we walked into the bar 2 seats opened up for my friend and I. We shared the Jameson chicken bbq sandwich. OMG, delicious. The fries were crunchy and salty, which complimented our choice of brews on tap. The bar is situated right in the middle of all the street action and there is a nice big entrance with wide open windows and seating outside. The bartenders were super attentive. I love the rustic wood feel of this bar, in traditional Irish Pub decor/style. We enjoyed this visit and will come again.

data.title: Great place to hang out
data.text: We had a good Irish meal (shepherds pie) that was reasonably priced. The waitress was lovely. Very helpful and quick, even though there was a small crowd and she was the only one!

data.title: Great pub
data.text: Service was fantastic. Drinks wetter wonderful. Just had appetizers but tasted great. Good place to gather written friends or work buddies for a drink or catch a game.

data.title: Fun Spot
data.text: My husband and I came here with another couple. We ordered apps, and other dishes too. The staff was great and very fun! We ended up staying a long time to wait out the rain and drink good beers! Loved this spot!

data.title: Just like Ireland, the good and the bad
data.text: This Irish pub sure is authentic, great food, plentiful drink and no service. Just like a pub in Ireland, but of course you expect that in Ireland, not so much a bar in Santa Rosa. Hard to attract staff, really slow this place down. Conversely they don't push you to over order. Food is good typical Irish pub food. Don't go in a rush.

data.title: why not try friendly?
data.text: why not try friendly?, was the best and constructive idea I could have asked at the bar or at the table. We've been there three times on different days: packed, medium packed and slow business. The sound of the staff and the quality was so that we will not be coming back.

data.title: Nice!
data.text: Good place to go with friends and to enjoy a beer! Nice music and people. Especial place to smoke. Second floor have a nice bar.

data.title: Tavern Steak and Shepherds Pie
data.text: We dropped in here to see the football game and grab a bite to eat.  Bar was full of fans but we nabbed a seat at the counter and had some tavern Steak and Shepherds pie, both good.  There were several people there I'd categorize as 'Characters' - one or two that raised a caution flag for me .. but maybe that's what we get for sitting at the bar.  I was told that when the band started the game would get turned off (boo!) but they didn't ... the band waited for the game to finish, I appreciated that.

data.title: Interesting...
data.text: Not an attentive staff. I won't be there again.. I was expecting more. The service was not that good. The temperature of the beer was ok but they need to be more attentive.

data.title: Sunday Small Bites Great
data.text: We stopped around noon and found the appetizer menu perfect for a small nosh. Two sirloin sliders that were very large for $5.50 and three potato skins for $5.00. Perfect. They serve the menu for happy hour during the week and Sunday 11-5. The food was good and our server quite friendly.

data.title: Jameson Burger blew me away!
data.text: Wanting to expand my culinary horizons, I had dinner here this evening. Ordered the “Jameson Burger,” and it blew me away. I’ve had great burgers before, but what set this one apart was the topping of “crispy onions,” sautéed to perfection. I’ve been around the block a few times, but I don’t recall ever experiencing grilled onions so explosively flavorful. This burger – which also served as the launching pad for a serving of cheddar, tomato, lettuce and “House Whiskey BBQ” sauce – delivered what I can only call a mouthgasm! If you haven’t been there yet, check this place out. Oh, and they also have a wide selection of brews, wines and spirits to quench your thirst!

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: My Wife & I had lunch. The Fish and Chips were the BEST we have had in the area  The Irish Bangers were Great also  Worth more visit to try other items on the Menu

data.title: Average Food OK Service
data.text: Irish pub had the corned beef and cabbage - it was OK, the corned beef had little flavor and a little tough, the cabbage was bland.  Needed some better music - Irish music would have been nice.

data.title: Inedible food, awful service
data.text:
We had a Groupon, so Hubby and I decided to try Stout's on a Tuesday night we were in Santa Rosa. We parked in the lot behind the restaurant (off 3rd St.) and entered through the back door. There's a hostess stand there; and the hostess greeted us, got our menus, and started leading us to a table in the front of the restaurant, telling us we could choose wherever we wanted to sit. Obviously, the restaurant wasn't very crowded <grin> even though it was still Happy Hour when we arrived. We seated ourselves as our hostess stopped to talk to a customer (friend?) sitting at a table across from us. She continued chatting with that customer for 3-4 minutes; then returned to her station in the back of the restaurant still carrying our menus with her, sitting in a chair with her back towards us. It took a good 5 minutes to catch the eye of another staff person and motion we needed help. The menus turned out to be quite confusing: once opened, you can't see half the menu while it looks like what you CAN see is all they offer. Our waiter finally showed us the trick it took to see the rest of the menu, saying he often has to do that so customers can see the full menu, which leaves me wondering why they don't just fix the menu...

We ordered: I ordered Fish & Chips, Hubby ordered the Jameson Chicken Sandwich. We'd also ordered cocktails when he first brought us menus, which hadn't arrived yet. As I said, it was Happy Hour and the restaurant wasn't very crowded, so we'd expected our cocktails to take little time; but when I asked him about the cocktails, he looked up at the bar and said 'oh, they're just pouring them now'. The truth was they WEREN'T pouring them because he'd forgotten to put our drink order in. We finally got our cocktails, which we sipped while waiting what seemed like forever for our meals. Our meals finally arrived: I picked up a piece of fish and it immediately slipped from my fingers, leaving the coating and a lot of grease behind in my hand. I put the fish down to clean my hand and tried a french fry: it, too, was overly greasy to the point of being inedible. I was trying to break off a piece of the bare fish to eat when our waiter returned to see if all was OK. I showed him my plate and even he was embarrassed: He could clearly see the deep-fryer grease dripping from my fingers, dripping from my food, and pooling on my plate...my entire plate was completely inedible. He offered to take my plate back and talk to the chef about it, which was quite appropriate; but then he returned and re-served my same plate, hanging his head and saying the chef refused to do anything about it. Huh? Hubby, in the meantime, had given up on his fries (dripping grease, like mine) and was trying to eat his sandwich; but the chicken breast itself was undercooked and smothered in an oily sauce that best resembled Italian salad dressing. We wound up sending both our plates back to the kitchen, unfinished (mine basically untouched). The bill came: there was a bar bill, which we expected, but no consideration given whatsoever for the bad food. Our waiter apologized left and right...but still demanded the Groupon, of course. We passed him on our way to the back door, leaning against the wall just outside the kitchen door chatting with the hostess (where I know he'd been most of the time we were there, because I could see him from where I was sitting), and he (but not the hostess) thanked us for coming. I replied, "Thank you for trying...too bad the food was so awful", and he said "Yes...sorry again for all the bad food". That was it.

Will we return? If drinks and dinner were FREE and edible, which is what I think is the least Stout's owes us, maybe...but just maybe. Otherwise, no - I don't like paying for bad dining experiences. I let Groupon know about our visit, too, and agreed to let them forward our bad experience to Stout's and that Stout's could contact me. It's been 3 weeks now, with no contact from Stout's: that if nothing else should tell you how interested they are in customer satisfaction. Bottom line: Don't go there!
